item.description:
Finally Timbila is going to play Boston! It's a homecoming for me, and I'm hoping to greet a nice crowd that night. Get the word out to all your pals in Beantown!

Timbila plays ecstatic African rock with an East Village edge. Guitarist Banning Eyre (veteran of ’90s Boston bands Rumbafrica, Kolo Mboka and Sankai) met singer/songwriter, mbira and marimba player Nora Balaban in Zimbabwe in 1997. Back in New York, they formed Timbila with the idea of keeping the deep roots of tradition, but channeled through their own roots in rock and dance band pop. Expect girl-band vocals, psychedelic guitar, deep funk grooves and dream-like musical textures. The trance of spirit possession merges with the trance of free-spirited head-bangers. No other band sounds like Timbila.

Don’t miss TIMBILA’s Boston debut at Johnny D’s, Saturday, May 7: 7-9PM
Johnny D’s
17 Holland Street
Somerville, MA 02144-2730
(617) 776-2004

Nora Balaban: mbira (thumb piano), timbila (xylophone) and vocals
Louisa Bradshaw: vocals
Banning Eyre: guitars
Dirck Westervelt: bass
Ed Klinger: drums and vocals

See Timbila’s amazing video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sGftjIsyGRg
Vimeo version: http://vimeo.com/20088388

Hear more Timbila music at Reverbnation: http://www.reverbnation.com/timbila
Or, on Bandcamp: http://timbila.bandcamp.com/
item.how_to_find_us: We will have dinner and reserve tables for our group.
item.why: Certainly one of the best group from the American international music scene that came out in recent years. Definitely not to be missed!
item.name: TIMBILA at Johnny D's
